Notes.Text:
This update for sssd fixes the following security issue:

- CVE-2018-10852: Set stricter permissions on /var/lib/sss/pipes/sudo to
  prevent the disclosure of sudo rules for arbitrary users (bsc#1098377).

Vulnerabilities.Description: The UNIX pipe which sudo uses to contact SSSD and read the available sudo rules from SSSD has too wide permissions, which means that anyone who can send a message using the same raw protocol that sudo and SSSD use can read the sudo rules available for any user. This affects versions of SSSD before 1.16.3.
